alert.note: Alert for Washington (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 09 at 8:44PM EST until January 09 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EST FOR WASHINGTON...NORTHERN CRAVEN...NORTHWESTERN HYDE...SOUTHEASTERN MARTIN AND CENTRAL BEAUFORT COUNTIES... At 842 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Windsor to near River Road, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Washington, Plymouth, River Road, Belhaven, Sladesville, Ransomville, Ponzer, Pinetown, Pungo, Blounts Creek, Pamlico Beach, Cox Crossroads, Wenona, Hinson, Bayview, Bunyan, Pike Road, Leechville, Winsteadville, and Core Point. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EST for eastern North Carolina. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across the area. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Newport. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
